revised_title: The Evolution of Mammals from Cotylosaurian Ancestors
tldr: Dr. Robert Broom discusses the evolution of mammals from Cotylosaurian ancestors through carnivorous Therapsida, Gorgonopsia, and Cynodonts. He argues that changes in diet and habitat led to the development of mammalian characteristics, such as a flexible skin with hair, a four-chambered heart, warm blood, and an increased cerebrum.
